intro: Hibbertia dentata, commonly known as the serrated hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five pointed lobes, often arranged in clusters. Hibbertia dentata typically grows in shrubland and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters.
